page.title: 17RELIGION WINTERBOURNE VALLEY
page.content: Religious beliefs of the area are mainly C/E for whom there is a church at Winterbourne Steepleton. Catholic or Methodist families must travel to Dorchester. {Parish} of Winterbourne Steepleton is within the Diocese of Salisbury & the Deanery of Dorchester, & has its own Parochial Church Council There are 16 on the Electoral Roll and church leaders are trying to make the church the focal point of the village as it has no shop or public house. The Rector (who serves 3 other parishes) conducts two services a month for an average congregation of 14. {Church}of St.Michael and All Angels Winterbourne Steepleton originated in C11 with many additions and rebuilding. People have worshipped here since Saxon times. Steepleton Angel on South Wall is an outstanding example of saxon sculpture Spire is one of only three in Dorset.
